results.title: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit glass slides (Birds)
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description: There are six parts to the bird slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. These slides form part of The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit with removable chimney and internal wooden block. The lantern is housed in original box with metal handle, and internal red and blue graphic for: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit. 20 glass slides in custom box, length of textile to keep box shut, 2 small empty boxes which act to store slides in a snug manner.

results.title: Australian aborigines: police tracker
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Modern social studies”
A First Nations man’s hunting and tracking skills and how they were learnt. Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land and produced in collaboration with Professor A.P. Elkin, Professor of Anthropology, University of Sydney.

results.title: The Landscape architects; Fire down below
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
“The Landscape architects” David Bellamy looks at how First Nations peoples learned to tame the countryside without becoming farmers, and at what sort of diet they enjoyed. “Fire Down Below” David Bellamy looks at the secrets of survival of the Australian flora against the frequent fires which seek to destroy.

results.title: Weipa people
results.creator_credit: Jane Scragg, Edwin Scragg, Comalco and Scope Films
results.brief_description: A film about the largest bauxite mining operation in the world. Also looks at the social conditions of the people who have moved to this remote North Queensland town and the impact of the new town on local First Nations peoples. Commentary by Richard Oxenburgh.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Scragg, Edwin Scragg, Comalco and Scope Films

results.title: People out of time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A study of the Bindubi tribe, Australian First Nations people who have mastered their arid, inhospitable environment in the Great Sandy Desert by using every resource to the maximum point of refinement. Filmed on Professor Donald Thompson’s 1963 expedition. Narrated by Leo McKern, filmed by David Corke and Len McLarty, written and presented by Eric Davidson.

results.title: Aborigines of the Northern Territory: scouting outpost
results.creator_credit: Cinesound Movietone, Bob Kingsbury, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Scouting has become an important activity among young children of Maningrida on the Arafura Sea in Northern Australia. In 1964 a school teacher introduced scouting, and its popularity led to the growth of the movement to include Cubs, Rovers and Guides. Young people from eleven First Nations peoples in the area are involved.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Cinesound Movietone, Bob Kingsbury, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Conciliation by Benjamin Duterrau, 1840
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye II”.
This film looks at the works of Benjamin Duterrau, and in particular his painting “The Conciliation”. This was of importance as, based on the meeting of George Augustus Robinson in 1830 with a group of Tasmanian First Nations people, it was the first painting of a historical scene created in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Film Australia
